alert.note: Alert for Copper River Basin (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 10:11AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...KENNICOTT GLACIER DAMMED HIDDEN LAKE RELEASING... Hidden Lake, which is dammed by the Kennicott Glacier, has begun to release and may cause a significant rise on the Kennicott River at McCarthy. The Kennicott River water level prior to the release was 1342.5 ft, gage datum, on the river gage. Expect water levels on the Kennicott River to rise an additional 2 to 5 feet over the next 24 to 48 hours. This is a yearly event that occurs in mid to late summer. Due to the lower than historical median water levels on the Kennicott River from cooler temperatures this past week, the glacial dammed lake release is expected to produce a smaller hydrographic response than in previous years. Persons living or traveling in the vicinity of the Kennicott River are urged to prepare for rapidly rising water and possible minor flooding and bank erosion during the next several days. Persons traveling for recreation should avoid parking or camping in low lying areas near the Kennicott River. The Chitina and Copper Rivers will experience moderate rises in water levels as the glacier dammed outburst wave progresses downstream. EXPECTED IMPACTS: Minor river bank erosion. Possible minor flooding in low lying areas.
